title: Once again explaining the issue with the Skarner rework but in another way.
body:
I have argued many times and made my feelings on this issue heard many times before this on how terrible the Skarner rework was. Having learned that they were going to, yet again, rework him because they realized it was a failure was offset by the fact that Repertoir has said that they like how well he's doing now that Dragon's are valuable and that they only intend for small changes.

This means that they still do not understand what the issue is with this rework and I am going to explain it again but with an example. 

Let us say that Riot decides they want to make {{champion:101}} a point blank burst mage that's good against divers. Sounds like a silly choice yes? 

But here's how they intend to do it, they make it so that all of his abilities do less damage the further they are from him, to such an extent that hitting with the very tip of your Q does less damage than his auto attacks. So suddenly Xerath's winrate against divers and melee champs is better than his winrate against ranged champs, people build him tanky ap with things like RoA and the new Hextech items, Riot deems it a success because now Xerath is doing what they wanted, he is good at super close range and bad at long range.

Now you tell me the obvious, this is completely ridiculous, Xerath is supposed to be a siege champ that has massive range, you haven't even changed his kit at all Specter, it's just made to be worse at range because of numbers. And this is exactly what's wrong with Skarner. His kit is not designed for neutral objective control, making it so his stats are terrible everywhere but around neutral objectives does not make him a good neutral objective controller, it makes him only useful around those objectives.

None of his skills are designed with the idea of controlling objectives and the rework was one of the shoddiest I've ever seen, it tried to make  huge changes to how people play him with the least amount of effort possible by making his numbers better when near crystals and bad when not.

This is not something that can be remedied with small changes, either he needs to be redone to something like what he was before the rework or they need to completely destroy him and redo all of his abilities from the ground up. The last rework was a half-hearted attempt at making him different and another half-hearted attempt at fixing it will just result in further failure.

Please make my favorite bug great again.

http://i.imgur.com/wuvyekw.jpg

Edit:
Someone has chided me for not giving my own solutions for Skarner. I admit, I too hate threads that just complain but don't suggest any solutions but ever since my application to Riot was rejected, I haven't felt much like posting ideas on the boards. Add to that that I have already given suggestions for this issue many times in the past and am tired of repeating myself about it and to no benefit and I think I'm justified in not posting any ideas in the OP. But I will do so now anyway since I had a discussion with someone else about how they could change Skarner.

One way to change Skarner is to make his ult capable of dragging his crystals but have it have a separate cooldown for using it on a crystal. This would allow you to SET UP where you want to put them so you could plan ahead on where you intend to fight. This would actually demonstrate some skill and require proper planing, both to set them up and to make sure you don't place one in a spot you could be zoned from. You'd have to reduce the range of the effects but at least this way you wouldn't be shackled to just fighting in the jungle.

Another thing would be to get rid of all the stat shit and instead make it so they give him utility or special effects on his abilities, the kinds of effects that would make him better at dealing with baron and dragon or maybe they'd give him his old passive on his Q again. Part of what makes the current crystals so bad is that they're just stat balls which is a lot of "invisible power" that Riot says they don't like.

Another would be to ditch the activation gimmick entirely and make it so Skarner's abilities, when used on the crystals, do more things. Maybe hitting his Q on a crystal causes it to ring out with a harmonic frequency that deals damage, or silences enemies for half a second, or maybe it slows enemies. Hitting his E on a crystal could cause a large beam of energy to shoot out towards the nearest enemy. Using his W while next to a crystal could apply his shield to all of his allies in range for half the value.

If we're talking about changes that involve the removal of the rock crutches, reverting him back to the version of him before the Juggernaut patch would be a fantastic solution that Riot would unfortunately never go for. So if it were something entirely different then perhaps make Skarner more like an actual scorpion, maybe remove his current ult and make his Q have him grab someone for a short time (Like .5 seconds) and make his E be a spammable short duration slow and his main damage source. Maybe make his W a crystal creator that has to be placed in the jungle or a bush and have it give him increased damage and so the idea is to drag someone to their doom into the crystal zone.

For now I'll need to stop since break ended but I'll continue this later.

replies.body:
I hate the crystals, and I think Riot knows they aren't a great idea. 

There are two kinds of minigames in LoL. There are minigames that involve everyone in the game, which usually suck, and there are minigames that involve just the champion and maybe one opponent. 

The ones that **force** involvement from the whole game usually suck because they occupy so much of the game-space when they are present. I would put things like Skarner's crystals and GP's barrels in this category, just as the most egregious failures, perhaps. 

Then there's the ideal minigame, like with Taric's passive interaction with his Q. The person playing Taric really cares about this minigame, and it directly affects your performance on the champion, but it doesn't require your opponent to think about it very much. Sure, they know that sometimes you can heal very big, and sometimes less, and that auto-attacking helps you heal for more in shorter spurts, and they can play around that. But they don't have to constantly worry about an object on the map, and getting steamrolled if they don't control if and watch it at all times. 

Most minigames fall between these two, and I think that's okay, but when Riot introduces something like Skarner's crystals, they need to rework it. It just occupies too much of the game to justify it's existence, even if it's "balanced." It brings up, for me, the big discussion between balance and health/fun, which is what you seem to be onto, as well. Yes, he's balanced like this. **That doesn't make him fun or interesting for the game. He is not. He is a bad champion right now, and it has nothing to do with balance.**

I honestly don't think GP's barrels, as a mini-game itself, is bad, I think the real issue with them is just that failing to beat him at his minigame is too punishing. The idea of having these crystals to capture for some kind of bonus isn't necessarily a bad idea either its just that the reward and the champion the passive is attached to aren't good.

That's a fair position, but lemme ask this, then...

Is there some reward that could be "good" and also balanced? Because I don't think so. I can see why you think it isn't that bad, but I can't think of anything that would feel good for the investment without being completely OP. Just my two cents.

If we're talking about the barrels, one change would be to get rid of the armor pen and instead make it an armor shred (Obviously for  less since it would help everyone on his team) so that he brings another source of utility to his team alongside his ult and they won't have such stupidly high burst and will require him to follow up on using his barrels.
I was mostly talking about Skarn. I just don't think he'll ever be fun with those crystals, and I do feel the same about GP's barrels, but your suggestion for those is a good one, for sure.

I actually have several ideas that they SHOULD have gone with. Ideas I came up with when this rework was first revealed to us in fact.

One is to make his ult capable of dragging his crystals but have it have a separate cooldown for using it on a crystal. This would allow you to SET UP where you want to put them so you could plan ahead on where you intend to fight. This would actually demonstrate some skill and require proper planing, both to set them up and to make sure you don't place one in a spot you could be zoned from. You'd have to reduce the range of the effects but at least this way you wouldn't be shackled to just fighting in the jungle.

Another thing would be to get rid of all the stat shit and instead make it so they give him utility or special effects on his abilities, the kinds of effects that would make him better at dealing with baron and dragon or maybe they'd give him his old passive on his Q again. Part of what makes the current crystals so bad is that they're just stat balls which is a lot of "invisible power" that Riot says they don't like.

Another would be to ditch the activation gimmick entirely and make it so Skarner's abilities, when used on the crystals, do more things. Maybe hitting his Q on a crystal causes it to ring out with a harmonic frequency that deals damage, or silences enemies for half a second, or maybe it slows enemies. Hitting his E on a crystal could cause a large beam of energy to shoot out towards the nearest enemy. Using his W while next to a crystal could apply his shield to all of his allies in range for half the value.

There are SO MANY ways that they could have made his crystals feel fun or satisfying, that's part of what galls me so much about it, they went with the laziest method for satisfaction by making them stat balls.

I also really like these ideas. Obviously they would require a lot more work than was probably initially planned for the juggernaut rework, but if Skarner were to get the full-level rework time, I think your ideas here have real potential. It would make him truly unique and would make me excited to play him. As he is right now, I still do enjoy him but I find myself getting bored with him quickly, similar to playing say, Warwick.
